metadata.feature_description: Provides multi-language support for all UI elements and messages in the PersonaBar.

steps.action: Navigated to Spanish locale by accessing http://localhost:8081/es-ar/
steps.expected: Page should load in Spanish locale with URL reflecting es-ar
steps.actual: Page loaded successfully with URL http://localhost:8081/es-ar/, Spanish flag became active in language selector

issues: PersonaBar UI strings remained in English instead of displaying Spanish translations

steps.action: Navigated to French locale by accessing http://localhost:8081/fr-fr/
steps.expected: Page should load in French locale with URL reflecting fr-fr
steps.actual: Page loaded successfully with URL http://localhost:8081/fr-fr/, French flag became active in language selector

issues: PersonaBar UI strings remained in English instead of displaying French translations

steps.action: Navigated to German locale by accessing http://localhost:8081/de-de/
steps.expected: Page should load in German locale with URL reflecting de-de
steps.actual: Page loaded successfully with URL http://localhost:8081/de-de/, German flag became active in language selector, Site Analytics panel displayed

issues: PersonaBar UI strings remained in English instead of displaying German translations

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Verify all UI strings are localized

steps.action: Examined PersonaBar UI elements across Spanish, French, and German locales
steps.expected: UI strings like 'Users', 'Add User', 'Search Users', 'Dashboard', 'Content', 'Settings' should be translated to the selected language
steps.actual: All UI strings remained in English across all tested locales. Labels such as 'Users', 'Add User', 'Remove Deleted Users', 'Show:', 'Authorized', 'Search Users', 'NAME', 'EMAIL', 'JOINED', 'Site Analytics', 'Insights', 'Top Fives', 'Assets' all displayed in English

issues: Spanish, French, and German translation resource files appear to be missing or not loaded for the PersonaBar UI
The localization framework falls back to English (default language) when translations are unavailable

steps.action: Examined date formats in the Users panel when viewing in Spanish locale
steps.expected: Date format should reflect locale-specific formatting (e.g., DD/MM/YYYY for European locales)
steps.actual: Dates displayed in DD/MM/YYYY format (e.g., 30/12/2025, 06/01/2026) instead of US format MM/DD/YYYY, indicating date format localization is working

steps.action: Navigated to Arabic locale by accessing http://localhost:8081/ar-er/
steps.expected: Page layout should switch to RTL (right-to-left) direction with PersonaBar on the right side and content flowing RTL
steps.actual: Page loaded in Arabic locale but layout remained LTR (left-to-right). PersonaBar stayed on the left side, text alignment remained left-aligned, and no RTL CSS transformation was applied to the PersonaBar interface

issues: RTL layout support is not implemented for the PersonaBar UI
Arabic locale selection does not trigger RTL CSS direction changes

steps.action: Verified that PersonaBar displays content when translation files are missing
steps.expected: System should fall back to default English language when requested translations are unavailable
steps.actual: System successfully fell back to English for all UI strings when Spanish, French, German, and Arabic translations were unavailable. No error messages or broken UI elements observed

observations: Code review shows localization infrastructure exists via .resx resource files (Evoq.resx) and JavaScript localization access (util.resx.Evoq)
The DNN Localization Engine dependency is functioning as URLs correctly reflect locale codes (es-ar, fr-fr, de-de, ar-er)
Translation resource files for Spanish, French, German, and Arabic appear to be missing for the PersonaBar UI module
Date formatting localization works correctly, suggesting the core localization framework is operational
RTL support for Arabic would require additional CSS and layout modifications that are not currently implemented in PersonaBar
